docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama has weighed in on the outcry over two straight years of all-white acting nominees for the Academy Awards.

headline.main: Obama Weighs In on Controversy Over All-White Oscar Slate
headline.print_headline: Obama Weighs In on Controversy Over All-White Oscar Slate

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama has weighed in on the outcry over two straight years of all-white acting nominees for the Academy Awards.

docs.lead_paragraph: The introduction of new European Union rules forcing insurers to hold enough capital to protect policyholders has gone well though some tweaks will be needed, Britain's top insurance regulator said on Wednesday.

headline.main: BoE Insurance Supervisor Says EU Capital Rules Off to Smooth Start
headline.print_headline: BoE Insurance Supervisor Says EU Capital Rules Off to Smooth Start

docs.snippet: The introduction of new European Union rules forcing insurers to hold enough capital to protect policyholders has gone well though some tweaks will be needed, Britain's top insurance regulator said on Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Anthem's fourth-quarter earnings tumbled 64 percent as the health insurer absorbed some sizeable expenses and booked fewer customers than it expected through the Affordable Care Act's public insurance exchanges.

headline.main: Anthem 4Q Profit Falls 64 Pct, Misses Expectations
headline.print_headline: Anthem 4Q Profit Falls 64 Pct, Misses Expectations

docs.snippet: Anthem's fourth-quarter earnings tumbled 64 percent as the health insurer absorbed some sizeable expenses and booked fewer customers than it expected through the Affordable Care Act's public insurance exchanges.

docs.lead_paragraph: The insurance giant brushed aside Carl Icahn’s push for a breakup, saying it would sell or spin off some businesses and create nine operating units.

headline.main: A.I.G. Opts for Streamlining, Spurning Calls for a Breakup
headline.print_headline: Resisting Pressure to Break Up, A.I.G. Plans to Streamline Instead

docs.abstract: American International Group announces effort to streamline its operations, including plans to spend $25 billion on stock buybacks and dividends and cut operating costs by $1.6 billion; move is meant to address activist investors' demands, led by Carl C Icahn, for company to be broken up into three entities in order to lose its classification as systemically important financial institution.
docs.snippet: The insurance giant brushed aside Carl Icahn’s push for a breakup, saying it would sell or spin off some businesses and create nine operating units.

docs.lead_paragraph: The price tag for taking a pass on health insurance is going up. That means a tough choice awaits many young adults. A closer look at the dilemma they face under the health care law:

headline.main: What We Know: Uninsured Young Adults Face Bigger Fines
headline.print_headline: What We Know: Uninsured Young Adults Face Bigger Fines

docs.snippet: The price tag for taking a pass on health insurance is going up. That means a tough choice awaits many young adults. A closer look at the dilemma they face under the health care law:

docs.lead_paragraph: Millions of young adults healthy enough to think they don't need insurance face painful choices this year as the sign-up deadline approaches for President Barack Obama's health care law.

headline.main: Health Care Fines Press Millennials as Deadline Nears
headline.print_headline: Health Care Fines Press Millennials as Deadline Nears

docs.snippet: Millions of young adults healthy enough to think they don't need insurance face painful choices this year as the sign-up deadline approaches for President Barack Obama's health care law.

docs.lead_paragraph: With Iowa kicking off the 2016 election season in one week, Democratic presidential front-runner Hillary Clinton tried to erase doubts about her judgment raised by rival Bernie Sanders on Monday while digging deep into her years of governing experience.

headline.main: Experience vs. Judgment: Clinton, Sanders Vie for Pivotal Iowa Vote
headline.print_headline: Experience vs. Judgment: Clinton, Sanders Vie for Pivotal Iowa Vote

docs.lead_paragraph: Thanks to Congress' recent tax-and-spending spree, Republicans intent on fulfilling a political promise will have to propose far deeper cuts to domestic programs to bring the government's deteriorating balance sheet back into the black.

headline.main: Analysis: GOP Needs Budget Cuts to Fulfill Political Promise
headline.print_headline: Analysis: GOP Needs Budget Cuts to Fulfill Political Promise

docs.snippet: Thanks to Congress' recent tax-and-spending spree, Republicans intent on fulfilling a political promise will have to propose far deeper cuts to domestic programs to bring the government's deteriorating balance sheet back into the black.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Clinton cast doubt on the feasibility of Bernie Sanders’s agenda, and he painted her judgment on foreign policy as weak.

headline.main: In Iowa Forum, Democrats Promote Themes for Final Stretch to Caucuses
headline.print_headline: In Iowa Forum, Democrats Promote Themes for Final Stretch to Caucuses

docs.abstract: Democratic presidential candidates meet for final debate ahead of Iowa caucuses; Hillary Rodham Clinton casts doubt on feasibility of Bernie Sanders' agenda, while he paints her judgment on foreign policy as weak.
docs.snippet: Hillary Clinton cast doubt on the feasibility of Bernie Sanders’s agenda, and he painted her judgment on foreign policy as weak.
